page.title: 09Churches
page.content: There is a Church of England church in Peak Forest which is dedicated to King Charles Saint and Martyr.The present building dates from 1877,there was an older church dating back to 1657.The church used to be able to grant special marriage licences and couples used to travel long distances to be married there- sometimes secretly. The vicar is responsible for a group of four parishes and also sits on the governing bodies of church schools. Services are weekly.Attendance has generally declined this century. There are two Methodist chapels.One is in Peak Forest and the other in Sparrowpit which also has regular Sunday School classes. All the churches have fundraising functions to raise money for their upkeep.These are social occasions in the villages.
